item.title: Torque Limiter System – Torque Limiter Control – Two Inoperative on One Gear Line Capped

remarks.para: Torque limiter control for two brakes on one truck may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated brakes are deactivated by an appropriate procedure,
Aircraft is operated in accordance with appropriate AOM/AA Data procedures, and
BRAKE LIMITER indication is not displayed on EICAS.

note.para: EICAS message BRAKE LIMITER may be displayed. If the advisory level message BRAKE LIMITER is displayed, then torque limiter control for more than one active brake per gear truck is inoperative and dispatch is not allowed.

numlitem.para: Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction,

note.para: At takeoff, weights greater than 720,000 lbs., flaps up maneuver speed (VREF + 100) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kts.). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.

placard.para: Placard near Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel ____ Torque Limiter Control "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
